verses.roman:
gaṅgāra mahattva--sādhya, sādhana tāhāra
viṣṇu-pādotpatti--'anumāna' alaṅkāra

synonyms: gaṅgāra—of the Ganges; mahattva—opulences; sādhya—subject matter; sādhana—means; tāhāra—of that; viṣṇu-pāda-utpatti—her origin from the lotus feet of the Lord; anumāna—called anumāna (hypothesis); alaṅkāra—an ornament.
translation: "The real glory of mother Ganges is that she has grown from the lotus feet of Lord Viṣṇu. Such a hypothesis is another ornament, called anumāna.
